snippet: A marked increase over the last decade in diagnoses of attention deficit hyperactivity disorder could fuel growing concern that the diagnosis and its medication are overused in American children.
abstract: Data from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention reflect a marked increase over the last decade in diagnoses of attention deficit hyperactivity disorder; finding is fueling growing concern among doctors and other health professionals that the diagnosis and its medication are overused in American children.

byline.original: By ALAN SCHWARZ and SARAH COHEN

lead_paragraph: A marked increase over the last decade in diagnoses of attention deficit hyperactivity disorder could fuel growing concern that the diagnosis and its medication are overused in American children.

headline.seo: More Diagnoses of A.D.H.D. Causing Concern
headline.main: A.D.H.D. Seen in 11% of U.S. Children as Diagnoses Rise
headline.print_headline: More Diagnoses of Hyperactivity in New C.D.C. Data

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations
